verses.kjv: For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder, which went out early in the morning to hire labourers into his vineyard.
verses.web: “For the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who was the master of a household, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.
verses.ct: "The kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.

verses.kjv: And when he had agreed with the labourers for a penny a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
verses.web: When he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
verses.ct: He agreed to pay them a denarius for the day and sent them off to work.

verses.kjv: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,
verses.web: He went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace.
verses.ct: Around 9 in the morning, he went out again and saw other people standing around in the marketplace with nothing to do.

verses.kjv: And said unto them; Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right I will give you. And they went their way.
verses.web: He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’ So they went their way.
verses.ct: He told them, 'Go work in my vineyard too, and I'll pay you whatever is fair.' So they went.

verses.kjv: Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour, and did likewise.
verses.web: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise.
verses.ct: He went out again around noon and again around 3 in the afternoon, doing the same thing each time.

verses.kjv: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle, and saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?
verses.web: About the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle. He said to them, ‘Why do you stand here all day idle?’
verses.ct: Then around 5 in the afternoon, he went out and found still more people standing around. He asked them, 'Why have you been standing here all day doing nothing?'

verses.kjv: They say unto him, Because no man hath hired us. He saith unto them, Go ye also into the vineyard; and whatsoever is right, that shall ye receive.
verses.web: “They said to him, ‘Because no one has hired us.’ “He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and you will receive whatever is right.’
verses.ct: They answered, 'Because no one has hired us.' He told them, 'Go work in my vineyard too, and you'll receive whatever is fair.'

verses.kjv: So when even was come, the lord of the vineyard saith unto his steward, Call the labourers, and give them their hire, beginning from the last unto the first.
verses.web: When evening had come, the lord of the vineyard said to his manager, ‘Call the laborers and pay them their wages, beginning from the last to the first.’
verses.ct: When evening came, the vineyard owner told his manager, 'Call the workers and pay them their wages — but start with the ones who were hired last and end with the ones hired first.'

verses.kjv: And when they came that were hired about the eleventh hour, they received every man a penny.
verses.web: “When those who were hired at about the eleventh hour came, they each received a denarius.
verses.ct: The workers hired at 5 in the afternoon came forward, and each one received a full denarius.

verses.kjv: But when the first came, they supposed that they should have received more; and they likewise received every man a penny.
verses.web: When the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise each received a denarius.
verses.ct: So when the workers who had been hired first came forward, they expected to receive more. But each of them also received just one denarius.

verses.kjv: And when they had received it, they murmured against the goodman of the house,
verses.web: When they received it, they murmured against the master of the household,
verses.ct: When they got their pay, they complained to the landowner.

verses.kjv: Saying, These last have wrought but one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us, which have borne the burden and heat of the day.
verses.web: saying, ‘These last have spent one hour, and you have made them equal to us, who have borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat!’
verses.ct: They said, 'These latecomers only worked one hour, and you paid them the same as us — and we've been working all day long in the scorching heat!'

verses.kjv: But he answered one of them, and said, Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst not thou agree with me for a penny?
verses.web: “But he answered one of them, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Didn’t you agree with me for a denarius?
verses.ct: But the landowner replied to one of them, 'Friend, I haven't cheated you. Didn't you agree to work for a denarius?

verses.kjv: Take that thine is, and go thy way: I will give unto this last, even as unto thee.
verses.web: Take that which is yours, and go your way. It is my desire to give to this last just as much as to you.
verses.ct: Take your pay and go. I've chosen to give these last workers the same amount I gave you.

verses.kjv: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own? Is thine eye evil, because I am good?
verses.web: Isn’t it lawful for me to do what I want to with what I own? Or is your eye evil, because I am good?’
verses.ct: Don't I have the right to do what I want with my own money? Or are you jealous because I'm generous?'

verses.kjv: So the last shall be first, and the first last: for many be called, but few chosen.
verses.web: So the last will be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few are chosen.”
verses.ct: In the same way, the last will be first, and the first will be last. Many are called, but few are chosen."

verses.kjv: And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart in the way, and said unto them,
verses.web: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside, and on the way he said to them,
verses.ct: As Jesus was heading up to Jerusalem, he pulled the 12 disciples aside and spoke to them privately along the way.

verses.kjv: Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests and unto the scribes, and they shall condemn him to death,
verses.web: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death,
verses.ct: "Listen," he said, "we're going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death

verses.kjv: And shall deliver him to the Gentiles to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify him: and the third day he shall rise again.
verses.web: and will hand him over to the Gentiles to mock, to scourge, and to crucify; and the third day he will be raised up.”
verses.ct: and turn him over to the Gentiles, who will mock him, whip him, and crucify him. But on the 3rd day, he will rise again."

verses.kjv: Then came to him the mother of Zebedee’s children with her sons, worshipping him, and desiring a certain thing of him.
verses.web: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, kneeling and asking a certain thing of him.
verses.ct: Then the mother of James and John — the sons of Zebedee — came to Jesus with her sons. She knelt before him and asked him for a favor.

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, What wilt thou? She saith unto him, Grant that these my two sons may sit, the one on thy right hand, and the other on the left, in thy kingdom.
verses.web: He said to her, “What do you want?” She said to him, “Command that these, my two sons, may sit, one on your right hand, and one on your left hand, in your Kingdom.”
verses.ct: "What do you want?" Jesus asked her. She said, "Promise me that in your kingdom, my 2 sons will sit in the places of highest honor — one at your right hand and one at your left."

verses.kjv: But Jesus answered and said, Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with? They say unto him, We are able.
verses.web: But Jesus answered, “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?” They said to him, “We are able.”
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "You don't understand what you're asking for. Can you drink the cup of suffering that I'm about to drink?" "We can," they replied.

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, Ye shall drink indeed of my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with: but to sit on my right hand, and on my left, is not mine to give, but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared of my Father.
verses.web: He said to them, “You will indeed drink my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with, but to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but it is for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "You will indeed drink from my cup. But the seats at my right and left aren't mine to give away. Those places belong to the ones my Father has already prepared them for."

verses.kjv: And when the ten heard it, they were moved with indignation against the two brethren.
verses.web: When the ten heard it, they were indignant with the two brothers.
verses.ct: When the other 10 disciples heard about this, they were furious with the 2 brothers.

verses.kjv: But Jesus called them unto him, and said, Ye know that the princes of the Gentiles exercise dominion over them, and they that are great exercise authority upon them.
verses.web: But Jesus summoned them, and said, “You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
verses.ct: So Jesus called them all together and said, "You know how it works in the world — rulers dominate their people, and those in power lord it over everyone beneath them.

verses.kjv: But it shall not be so among you: but whosoever will be great among you, let him be your minister;
verses.web: It shall not be so among you, but whoever desires to become great among you shall be your servant.
verses.ct: But it must not be that way among you. Instead, whoever wants to be great among you must be your servant.

verses.kjv: And whosoever will be chief among you, let him be your servant:
verses.web: Whoever desires to be first among you shall be your bondservant,
verses.ct: Whoever wants to be first among you must be your slave.

verses.kjv: Even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
verses.web: even as the Son of Man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.ct: That's exactly why the Son of Man came — not to be served, but to serve others, and to give his life as a ransom for many."

verses.kjv: And as they departed from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.
verses.web: As they went out from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.
verses.ct: As they were leaving Jericho, a huge crowd followed Jesus.

verses.kjv: And, behold, two blind men sitting by the way side, when they heard that Jesus passed by, cried out, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord, thou son of David.
verses.web: Behold, two blind men sitting by the road, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out, “Lord, have mercy on us, you son of David!”
verses.ct: 2 blind men were sitting beside the road, and when they heard that Jesus was passing by, they shouted, "Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!"

verses.kjv: And the multitude rebuked them, because they should hold their peace: but they cried the more, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord, thou son of David.
verses.web: The multitude rebuked them, telling them that they should be quiet, but they cried out even more, “Lord, have mercy on us, you son of David!”
verses.ct: The crowd told them to be quiet, but they only shouted louder: "Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus stood still, and called them, and said, What will ye that I shall do unto you?
verses.web: Jesus stood still, and called them, and asked, “What do you want me to do for you?”
verses.ct: Jesus stopped and called out to them. "What do you want me to do for you?" he asked.

verses.kjv: They say unto him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.
verses.web: They told him, “Lord, that our eyes may be opened.”
verses.ct: "Lord," they said, "we want to see."

verses.kjv: So Jesus had compassion on them, and touched their eyes: and immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed him.
verses.web: Jesus, being moved with compassion, touched their eyes; and immediately their eyes received their sight, and they followed him.
verses.ct: Filled with compassion, Jesus touched their eyes. Instantly they could see, and they followed him.
